docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
This is meant to be a quick solution to a recipe sharing problem. Some imrpovements (hopefully) coming in the future:

  • Better cataloging so it's easier to "discover" recipes.
  • Impelement (somehow) with cooklang language so that recipes can be interacted with more effectively.
  • This might require turning this into a WASM.

For now, use the tags below to provide some minimally useful recipe selection.

docs.title: breakfast
docs.text:
• Coconut Chia Oatmeal

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 500 g lamb (ground)
  • 10 g salt
  • 2 tsp cumin (ground)
  • 2 tbsp sumac (ground)
  • 2 tbsp Urfa pepper (flakes)
  • 2 tbsp water
  • 1 ea red onion (thinly sliced)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Combine lamb with 7.5 g salt, 1 teaspoon cumin, 2 teaspoon sumac, and 1 tbsp pepper flakes.
  2. Knead until mixture turns tacky and sticks to side of bowl. Add water and knead until incorporated.
  3. Chill in refrigerator
  4. Combine 1 tsp cumin, 2 tsp sumac, 1 tbsp pepper flakes, and 2 tsp salt in small bowl
  5. Combine red onion and 2 tsp sumac in a medium bowl, season with salt to taste.
  6. Using wet hands, divide lamb into 12 even balls. Form each ball into long, flat kebab around skewer
  7. Cook on a grill sprinkling with spice mixture and turning occasionally, about 12 minutes total

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Serious Eats

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• I use (what I think is) a baby-food freezer tray. It has 1-oz "muffin" compartments and I fill them to the brim (so probably ~1.25 oz each), this makes ~20+ muffins with that.
  • Typically use a granular sugar substitute like those labeled as monk-fruit extract (and typically have erythritol as well).

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cup almond flour (8 oz)
  • 1.5 tsp baking powder
  • 0.125 teaspoon salt
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 2 tsp lemon zest
  • 4 eggs
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 2 cups grated carrots (10 oz)
  • 0.5 cup sugar

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 350 deg F and grease muffin tin.
  2. Combine everything except the almond flour in a blender and blend until smooth.
  3. Add almond flour to mixing bowl, then add contents from blender and mix well with saptula.
  4. Place in muffin tin and cook for 25 minutes. Remove and let cool.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Modifed from NY Times Flourless Carrot Cake (paywall)

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup toor dhal
  • 2 green chilies
  • 1 lbs pumpkin chopped
  • 2 ea chopped onions
  • 2 ea chopped tomatoes
  • 1 tsp turmeric powder
  • 0.5 cup tamarind extract
  • 0.5 tsp mustard seeds
  • 0.5 tsp asafoetida
  • 1 tsp jaggery
  • Salt to taste
  • 2 tbsp ghee
  • 10 ea curry leaves
  • 1 bunch cilantro chopped

docs.title: Masala
docs.text:
• 2 tbsp chana dhal
  • 2 tbsp coriander seeds
  • 0.25 tsp fenugreek seeds
  • 8 ea red chillies
  • 2 tbsp coconut grated
  • 1 tbsp ghee

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Oil roast the masala ingredients, side aside to cool. Once cooled, grind/blend together into a paste.
  2. Saute mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies in oil until fragrant and mustard sputters.
  3. Add assafoetida and fry for ~10 seconds.
  4. Add onion and saute until soft.
  5. Add masala paste, tomatoes, pumpkin, toor dhal, turmeric, salt, and additional water to preference (~1 liter).
  6. Cook on high in a pressure cooker for 8 minutes and allow a natural (slow) release.
  7. Once cooked, add jaggery (if using) and mix well, then garnish with chopped cilantro and and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Divya's Nalabhagam

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 heads broccoli
  • 8 slices bacon (chopped)
  • 1 cup red onion diced
  • 0.5 cup raisins (chopped)
  • 0.5 cup pumpkin seeds (salted and roasted)
  • 1 cup mayonnaise
  • 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Mix mayonnaise and vinegar, set aside.
  2. Chop broccoli to small pieces (small bites).
  3. Chop or crumble bacon to small bits.
  4. Put broccoli, bacon, onion, raisins, and seeds to a large bowl.
  5. Mix in the salad dressing.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Could use sunflower (or other) seeds instead of pumpkin.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: whole lotta yum

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 pounds sweet potatoes
  • 4 tbsp butter/ghee/coconut oil
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Heat oven to 425 deg F.
  2. Cut sweet potatoes into ~1-inch-thick rounds
  3. Place on baking sheet, arrange in one layer with at least 0.5 inches between each other.
  4. Drizzle butter/oil over the potates.
  5. Roast for 20 minutes, flip, then roast 20 minutes more.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: Consider spicing the butter with things like: - Salt - Pepper - Garlic - Onion - Sage - Thyme - Oregano

docs.title: Source
docs.text: the kitchn

docs.title: Buttery Roasted Parsnips with Mole Crunch
Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1/4 cup kosher salt
  • 2 pounds parsnips
  • 1/4 cup unsalted butter
  • 1/2 cup mole crunch

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Pre-heat oven to 425 deg F.
  2. Fill large pot with water and start to boil, add salt.
  3. Trim parsnips and cut in half across their width (where they begin to taper).
  4. Cut the top halves along their length to match the width of the bottom half.
  5. Boil parsnips for 4-6 minutes, until slightly firm by pliable.
  6. Drain water and add butter to parsnips, tossing it so it melts.
  7. Spread parsnips on baking sheet.
  8. Roast on center rack until tender and caramelized.
  9. Pile parsnips on serving platter and sprinkle with mole crunch.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Vegetable Revelations (Steven Satterfield)

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 gal milk
  • 2 cans (14 oz) sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 tbsp cardamom
  • 1 cup pistachios (chopped)
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Heat milk in large pot and add sweetened condensed milk.
  2. Keep the temperature low (so that the milk doesn't burn).
  3. Frequently (or constantly) stir and scrape the sides.
  4. Cook until the liquid is reduced to half the quantity (it will be pretty thick).
  5. Remove from heat and add salt, cardamom, and pistachios.
  6. Let the mixture cool a bit and pour it into your choice of container (sheet-cake pan, popsicle sticks, ice-cube trays, small cups, etc.)
  7. Place in freezer until frozen solid and serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: This guy on YouTube and others.

docs.title: Cashew Sweet Cream
docs.text: A (sort of) whipped cream substitute

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup cashews raw
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 1 tbsp sweetener (honey, sugar, syrup)
  • salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Soak cashews overnight.
  2. Drain cashews and blend with other ingredients.
  3. Sweeten and salt to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Simple Veganista

docs.title: Cauliflower Salad with Celery, Dried Apricots, and Pistachios
Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1-1/2 pounds cauliflower
  • 2 cup celery, diced
  • 1 cup dried apricots, chopped
  • 1/2 cup roasted pistachios, chopped
  • 1 recipe sumac vinaigrette
  • 1/2 tsp kocher salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Grate cauliflower into a large bowl (chop any pieces that cannot be grated).
  2. Add celery, apricots, and pistachios to the bowl and mix well.
  3. Add vinaigrette and salt and toss.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Vegetable Revelations (Steven Satterfield)

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 ea onion (sliced)
  • 4 lb pork (large chunks)
  • 7 oz chipotle in adobo (can)
  • 0.25 cup apple cider vinegar
  • 0.25 cup fish sauce
  • 1 tbsp garlic (powder)
  • 1 tbsp cumin (powder)
  • 2 tbsp oregano (dry)
  • 1 tsp bay leaves (powder)
  • 1 tsp cacao (powder)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Fry sliced onions in instant pot
  2. If pork is not in chunks (~3 inches) cut it into chunks
  3. Add pork and all other ingredients to instant pot
  4. Cook on high pressure for 45 minutes, allow natural release

docs.title: Source
docs.text: myself

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cup rice (jasmine preferred)
  • 2 small limes
  • 1 bunch cilantro
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tbsp oil

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Rinse rice a few times and drain as much water out as you can.
  2. Add 2 cups of water and put on medium heat.
  3. Add salt and oil
  4. Zest the two limes and add to the rice.
  5. Juice zested limes and add to rice.
  6. Bring water to a boil, then reduce heat to very low and place a top partially on top (so some of the steam can escape).
  7. Chop cilantro.
  8. When rice is done, take off heat and stir in cilantro, then let rest with the top on.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Simplified version of this

docs.title: Coconut Chia Oatmeal
docs.text: We mostly use this when traveling for a quick cooking breakfast or snack

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 oz rolled oats
  • 0.5 oz chia seeds
  • 0.5 oz coconut milk powder
  • 0.5 oz coconut flakes
  • 1 oz sliced almonds
  • 0.7 oz raisins
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 pinch cinnamon

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Combine all ingredients together.
  2. Put in heat resistant container and pour in boiling water.
  3. Let steep until desired tenderness.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Substitute almonds and raisins for other fruits and nuts as desired.
  • Coconut milk powder can be hard to find. My brick-and-mortar source is a Thai grocery store, but it has some sucralose added, so not ideal.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Andrew Skurka

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 100 gram sugar
  • 140 gram heavy cream
  • 5 gram vanilla extract
  • 0.125 tsp salt
  • 225 gram cream cheese

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cool the mixing bowl and sugar to under 70 F
  2. Wisk sugar, cream, vanilla, and salt at medium-low speed until sugar is dissolved.
  3. Increase to high until mixture is like Greek yogurt
  4. Add cream cheese 2 tbsp at a time, shut off mixture once incorporated
  5. Scrape bowl then continue mixing on high until it is smooth and light

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Serious Eats

docs.title: Curry Noodles with Chicken
docs.text: kuaitiao kaeng sai kai ก๋วยเตี๋ยวแกงไส้ ไก่

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 lb chicken (sliced)
  • 1 tbsp oil
  • 0.25 cup coconut crean
  • 3 tbsp red curry paste
  • 2 tbsp yellow curry paste
  • 2 tbsp palm sugar
  • 3 tbsp fish sauce
  • 1.5 cup coconut milk
  • 3 cup chicken stock
  • 6 oz extra-firm tofu (sliced into sticks)
  • 2 tsp curry powder
  • 8 oz mung bean sprouts
  • 8 oz rice noodles
  • 0.25 cup preserved radish (finely chopped)
  • 0.25 cup fried shallots
  • 0.25 cup cilantro (chopped)
  • 0.33 cup roasted peanuts (finely chopped)
  • 2 ea medium-boiled egg (halved)
  • 3 ea limes (wedges (table seasoning))
  • 0.25 cup fish sauce ((table seasoning))
  • 0.25 cup granulated sugar ((table seasoning))
  • 2 tbsp red chile powder ((table seasoning))

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cut chicken against the grain into slices (bize size), set aside.
  2. Cook oil, coconut cream, and curry pastes in medium/large pot for ~2 min.
  3. Add chicken and stir to coat chicken with paste, then cook ~1 min
  4. Add sugar, fish sauce, coconut milk, and stock; stir well and cook until chicken is cooked
  5. Add tofu (sliced in to 1/4" sticks) and curry powder, mix well and set pot to simmer
  6. Heat water to boil, blanch bean sprouts (very quickly)
  7. Cook noodles in same water
  8. Divide noodles and sprouts into bowls
  9. Ladle curry over the noodles, sprinkle with radish, shallots, cilantro, and peanuts.
  10. Top with egg half and serve

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Simple Thai Food

docs.title: Dry Fried Green Beans
docs.text: Ganbian Sijidou 干煸四季豆

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 14 oz green beans
  • Oil
  • 2.5 oz ground pork
  • 0.5 tbsp Shaoxing wine
  • 4.5 tbsp Yibin yacai (preserved vegetables)
  • 2 tsp light soy sauce
  • 1 tsp sesame oil

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cut beans into bite sized pieces.
  2. Deep fry beans in a wok (or roast them with oil) and set beans aside.
  3. In the wok, cook the pork, splashing the meat with the wine.
  4. Once cooked, add the beans and stir fry very hot.
  5. Add the preserved vegetables and soy sauce.
  6. Remove from heat and add sesame oil.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: The Food of Sichuan

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 500 gram all-purpose flour
  • 10 gram kosher salt
  • 4 gram instant dry yeast
  • 400 gram room temperature water
  • 68 gram extra-virgin olive oil
  • Coarse sea salt

docs.title: Make the Dough
docs.text:
1. Combine flour, kosher salt, and yeast in bowl.
  2. Mix in water and stir until no dry flour remains.
  3. Add 20 grams of olive oil, use hands to work it into the dough.
  4. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and let rest at room temperature for 1 hour.
  5. Remove plastic wrap, using a greased scraper fold dough over itself (lift and fold one edge toward middle).
  6. Rotate 45 degrees and repeat (keep rotating / repeating for 6 total times).
  7. Cover and let rest for 15 minutes.
  8. Repeat steps 5 and 6 again.
  9. Cover bowl tightly with plastic wrap and store in refrigerator for 18 to 72 hours.

docs.title: Bake
docs.text:
1. Remove dough from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 10 minutes.
  2. Sprinkle with flour then transfer to a floured working surface.
  3. Tuck the dough underneath intself until it is a tight ball.
  4. Pour 27 grams of olive oil into 10 or 12 inch skillet (or other baking pan), spread over entire surface (including rim).
  5. Place dough in pan and coat in oil (seam side down).
  6. Spread the dough out to flatten, don't worry if the dough does not reach the edges.
  7. Cover tightly and let sit for 1.5 to 2 hours (it will become soft and puffy).
  8. One hour before baking, preheat oven to 500 deg F and place a baking stone or steal on lower-middle position rack.
  9. After the dough is puffy, use oiled fingers to press the dough to the edges of the pan, you may need to lift the dough up in places to allow air bubbles to escape.
  10. Create small dimples in the dough surface with your fingers and drizzle remaining oil (20 grams) over the dough.
  11. Sprinkle with sea salt.
  12. Place skillet / pan on top of baking steel / stone.
  13. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, rotate the pan 180 degrees half-way through the baking process.
  14. Let bread rest for 5 minutes after removal from oven, then brush with a little more oil.
  15. Let cool for 10 more minutes before it's ready.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Serious Eats

docs.title: Fragrant Beets and Cherries with Cashew Butter
Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1-1/2 pound red beets
  • 3/4 cup red wine vinegar
  • 1/3 cup olive oil
  • 1/3 cup dried chamomile flowers
  • 1/3 cup dried hibiscus flowers
  • 2 tbsp kosher salt
  • 1/2 cup cashew butter
  • 1 tbsp lemon juice
  • 1/2 pound cherries, pitted and halved
  • 1/2 cup chopped roasted cashews
  • 1/2 cup mint leaves
  • flaky sea salt
  • black pepper

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Pre-heat oven to 375 deg F.
  2. Place beets in a dish just big enough to fit them.
  3. Mix red wine vinegar, olive oil, kosher salt, chamomile, and hibiscus.
  4. Pour liquid mixture over the beets into their dish.
  5. Cover beets with parchment paper and foil, seal tightly around lip of the dish.
  6. Place dish in the oven.
  7. After an hour, check for doneness (it usually takes a while).
  8. If not done, add water (if needed), reseal, and place back in oven. Check again every 20 minutes until done.
  9. When done, remove from oven and rotate beets face down into the liquid (upside down from how they cooked) and let cool. If you're in a hurry, you can dump the beets in ice-water to cool them.
  10. Using your hands, peel the beets and rip them into bite-sized chunks, place in a bowl and set aside.
  11. Combine cashew butter, 1/2 tsp of salt, lemon juice, and 2 tbsp water; mix thoroughly, add water until it is easily spreadable.
  12. Spread cashew butter on a serving platters, then top with beets.
  13. Sprinkle with some lemon juice and olive oil.
  14. Top with roasted cashews, sea salt, ground pepper, and mint.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• The first few times I did this I used dried cherries instead of fresh and it turned out really good.
    • If you do this, I recommend using ~half the stated mass (dried cherries are much lighter).
  • Substitute cashew butter and/or roasted cashews for other nut butters and/or nuts as needed.
    • Sunflower butter and roasted pistachios is a good combination.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Vegetable Revelations (Steven Satterfield)

docs.title: Grilled Bananas with Coconut Cream and Turmeric
docs.text: gluay yang kamin

docs.title: Sauce
docs.text:
• 2 cup coconut cream
  • salt pinch
  • 0.25 cup palm sugar
  • 2 tbsp black coconut sugar
  • 2 pandanus leaves knotted
  • 2 tbsp turmeric finely chopped

docs.title: Other
docs.text:
• 5 ea bananas (small)
  • 2 tbsp lime juice
  • 1 portion of sweet sticky rice
  • 0.25 cup coconut cream

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Make sticky rice.
  2. Peel bananas and steep in water mixed with lime juice while working on other items.
  3. Combine the sauce ingredients together and simmer until thickened (7 - 10 minutes).
  4. Grill bananas then press between two flat surfaces (this can be a challenge, and often the bananas will stick and fall apart, so feel free to skip if it is too frustrating, the end product is still good).
  5. Simmer the bananas in the sauce for approximately 10 more minutes.
  6. Remove bananas and grill a second time to carmelize the outside (this can also be a challenge, so feel free to skip, though it does add nicely to the end result).
  7. Serve bananas over the sticky rice with the sauce drizzled on top.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: 1. This is a much less sweet version of the one from the source below. It uses 1/8th the sugar of the original, but I think it is still sufficiently sweet.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Thai Food

docs.title: Herb-Baked Cashews
docs.text: met mamuang himma-phan op samunphrai

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb raw cashews
  • 1 tbsp oil
  • 0.25 cup lime juice
  • 1 ea lime zest
  • 1 tbsp cilantro (chopped)
  • 1 tbsp mint (chopped)
  • 1 tbsp green onion (chopped)
  • 2 tbsp honey
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 tsp chili powder

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 400 deg F and line baking sheet with parchment paper or mat (not necessary)
  2. Combine all ingredients in a bowl, mix well to coat cashews
  3. Spread cashews on baking sheet
  4. Bake for 20 - 25 minutes, stir every 5 minutes

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Simple Thai Food

docs.title: Herbal Salmon Salad
docs.text: phla pla salmon

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 4 ea lemongrass stalk (sliced)
  • 2 ea large shallots (sliced)
  • 3 ea thai chili (sliced)
  • 0.25 cup lime juice
  • 3 tbps fish sause
  • 1.5 lb salmon fillet (cubed)
  • 1 cup mint (chopped)
  • 4 ea kaffir lime leaves (strips)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Remove outer portion of lemongrass stalks, slice paper-thin
  2. Halve shallots, then slice lengthwise very thin
  3. Add to bowl: lemongrass, shallots, chiles, lime juice, and fish sauce; set aside
  4. Boil salmon cubes (~1.5 inches) in water (1-2 minutes)
  5. Remove salmon, shake off water, add to bowl of other ingredients
  6. Toss and adjust seasons as necessary
  7. Should be: sour, some salty and hot
  8. Sprinkle with mint leaves and serve

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Simple Thai Food

docs.title: Kale and Chickpea Curry
docs.text: Sholay Saag

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 tbsp rapeseed oil
  • 0.5 tsp mustard seeds
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 ea large onion (diced)
  • 4 ea garlic cloves (crushed)
  • 200 g tomatoes (canned)
  • 800 g chickpeas (drained)
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1.5 tsp coriander seeds
  • 1 ea green chilli (chopped)
  • 1 tsp red chilli (powder)
  • 1 tsp turmeric (powder)
  • 200 g kale (chopped)
  • 1 ea green chilli (sliced)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. If not using canned chickpeas, soak and cook chickpeas.
  2. Heat oil, when hot add mustard seeds then cumin seeds. Stir till aromatic and mustard seeds stop sizzling (if using powdered cumin, add that after mustard seeds stop sizzling, the powder will burn easily).
  3. Add diced onions and cook until brown, then add garlic and fry for ~4 minutes. Add tomatoes and let simmer. Additional water may be required.
  4. Add coriander, chopped green chilli, chilli powder, turmeric, and salt. Simmer for ~10 minutes or until the tomatoes are breaking down.
  5. Add chickpeas, fully coat with masala and let simmer for 5 minutes (additional water may be required).
  6. Add chopped kale and let cook until kale is tender.
  7. Serve with sliced green chilli as garnish

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Hari Ghotra

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 cups coconut milk.
  • 4 cups water
  • 3 ea sweet potatoes
  • 0.5 pounds kale
  • 2 ea limes juiced
  • 0.25 cup peanut butter
  • 1 ea green chili
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 1.5 inch ginger
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • 2 tsp paprika
  • 2 tbsp fishsauce
  • 1 cup cilantro chopped

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Fry ginger and garlic until just before they burn (not too long) in a large pot.
  2. Add coconut milk, water, peanutbutter, turmeric, green chili, and sweet potatoes, and bring to medium heat.
  3. When potatoes are cooked, add paprika, fish sauce, and kale.
  4. When the kale is cooked, add lime juice and cilantro.
  5. Serve with rice and fried eggs.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • This is a simplified version of the Serious Eats original recipe.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Serious Eats

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2.5 cup almond flour
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 2 tsp baking power
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 3 tbsp butter
  • 2 ea eggs
  • 0.25 cup milk

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 350 F
  2. Mix dry ingredients
  3. Mash in butter (so the batter is a dry crumble)
  4. Add wet ingredients
  5. Drop 1/4 cup portions of biscuits onto lined pan
  6. Bake 12 minutes, let cool once out of the oven

docs.title: Source

docs.text:

docs.title: Source
docs.text: An Edible Mosaic

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 cup almond flour
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp cinnamon
  • 0.5 tsp nutmeg
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 5 ea eggs
  • 1.5 cups sweetener (granulated)
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract
  • 0.5 cup oil
  • 2 cup carrots (shredded)
  • 0.5 cup shredded coconut
  • 0.5 cup apple (shredded)
  • 0.5 cup walnuts (chopped)
  • 2 cups creamcheese frosting

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 350 F, grease two 8-inch cake pans
  2. Combine dry ingredients
  3. Beat eggs and sweetener together until double in size, add vanilla extract
  4. Fold dry ingredients into eggs/sweetener/vanilla
  5. Split batter between the two pans, bake for 30 to 35 minutes

docs.title: Source
docs.text: unknown

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.5 cup almond flour
  • 0.5 cup psyllium husk
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 1 cup water (warm)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F
  2. Mix dry ingredients.
  3. Mix in the water and rest. Allow the pizza dough to rest for at least 5 minutes before working.
  4. Roll out the dough to form the 1/4 inch thick crust (between two pieces of parchment paper to avoid sticking)
  5. Repair any cracks in the crust, use wetted fingers
  6. Sprinkle with salt and bake for 8-10 minutes on 400°F stone or baking sheet until the crust is firm. Remove and cool for a few minutes before topping.
  7. Add toppings and bake at 425°F for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is cooked and ready.
  8. Let pizza cool before slicing

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Reddit

docs.title: Laap
docs.text:
ลาบ

This is a simplified version of a recipe in Hawker Fare. The book includes some additional recipes with organ and / raw meat that might be worth a try.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 350 gram meet
  • 0.5 cup shallots, thinly sliced
  • 1 tbsp toasted rice powder
  • 2 ea Thai chiles, thinly sliced
  • 1 tbsp ground toasted chili
  • 4 tbsp fish sauce
  • 3 tbsp scallions, thinly sliced
  • 0.25 cup mint leaves, chopped
  • 0.25 cup cilantro, chopped
  • 0.125 cup culantro, chopped

docs.title: Garnish Options
docs.text:
• Green cabbage
  • Cucumbers
  • Fried pork skin

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. If using non-minced meat, chop it into small chunks.
  2. Saute the meet in a pan (use oil if needed).
  3. Transfer the meet with juices / oil to a large bowl, let cool until room temperature.
  4. Mix non-herb ingredients in thoroughly.
  5. Once mixed, add the herbs and mix again

docs.title: Note
docs.text: • Serve with garnishes listed above and sticky rice.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Hawker Fare

docs.title: Mango Sticky Rice
docs.text: khao niao mamuang

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 portion of sweet sticky rice
  • 8 whole mangoes (sliced)
  • 1 cup coconut cream
  • 0.25 cup sugar
  • 2 tbsp palm sugar
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Make sticky rice.
  2. Over low to medium heat, dissolve sugar and salt in the coconut cream.
  3. Slice mangoes and serve over rice, with sweetened coconut cream poured over the top

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: 1. Consider serving with a crunchy garnish like seasame seeds or other roasted nuts.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Simple Thai Food

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:

  • 0.5 cup masa flour
  • 1 cup water
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 tbsp oil
  • 2 tbsp sugar

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Crack eggs in bowl, add water, salt, and sugar
  2. Wisk / beat the mixture well
  3. Add masa and mix well
  4. Let sit for ~30 minutes
  5. Make pancakes!

  • 3 bell peppers
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 1 ea small onion

  • 2 tbsp chopped raisins
  • 2 tbsp cacao nibs
  • 1 tbsp toasted sesame seeds
  • 1 tbsp toasted cumin seeds

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Vegetable Revelations (Steven Satterfield)

docs.title: Pork Vindaloo
docs.text: yogurt is a good addition to this, it can be spicy

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 600 grams pork chunks
  • 1 tsp mustard seeds
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 2 tsp coriander seeds
  • 4 cloves
  • 7 dried Kashmiri chilies
  • 1 tsp black peppercorns
  • 2 onions chopped
  • 6 cloves garlic
  • 3 cm ginger
  • 4 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tsp turmeric powder
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Grind 1 tsp mustard with all of the cumin, coriander, cloves, chillies, and peppercorns to powder.
  2. Blend the ground spices with onions, garlic, ginger, vinegar to a smooth paste, may require a little water.
  3. Mix meat with turmeric, salt, and 2 tbsp of the spice paste, let marinate for at least 20 minutes.
  4. Heat oil in a pan and add remaining 1 tsp mustard seeds.
  5. When the seeds start to pop, add the remaining spice paste and cook to brown the paste until fragrant.
  6. Add meat at stir-fry a few minutes, reduce heat and cover to simmer for 30 to 40 minutes.
  7. Keep the heat very low and stir often enough for it not to stick. Add water if needed.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
1. Use chilies de árbol in the place of kashmiri chilies if you cannot find the latter.
  2. Eat by itself, or with yogurt, rice and/or naan.
  3. You can also use use a pressure cooker to speed up the cooking process. Cook on high for 10 minutes and immediately release the pressure.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Hari Ghotra

docs.title: Pressure Cooker Times
docs.text: Kidney beans (soaked) : 10 minutes

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 cup quinoa (uncooked)
  • 14 oz can artichokes
  • 14 oz can diced tomatoes
  • 2 ea zucchini
  • 1 ea onion
  • 1 ea red bell pepper
  • 8 oz chopped mushrooms
  • 1 tsp turmeric
  • 2 tsp thyme
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • 0.5 tsp ground bay leaves
  • 4 ea cloves garlic
  • 1 bunch parsley
  • 1 ea lemon

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cook quinoa (if needed).
  2. Dice zucchinis, onion, mushrooms, red bell pepper, garlic.
  3. Saute chopped vegetables in pan, then add tomatoes when soft.
  4. Add spices and cook for a bit.
  5. Add quinoa and mix well, top with parsley and lemon jiuce before serving.

docs.title: Red Lentils Curry
docs.text: masoor dal

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 tbsp oil
  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 green chili
  • 0.5 cup onions diced
  • 0.5 tbsp garlic minced
  • 0.5 tbsp ginger grated
  • 1 cup tomatoes chopped
  • 1 cup red lentils (masoor dal)
  • 3 cups water
  • 1 tbsp lime juice
  • cilantro to garnish

docs.title: Spices
docs.text:
• 0.5 tsp ground turmeric
  • 0.5 tsp coriander powder
  • 0.5 tsp red chili powder
  • 0.5 tsp garam masala
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. In a pressure cooker, saute oil and cumin seeds (let the seeds brown slightly).
  2. Add green chili, onions, ginger and garlic and saute until onions are golden brown (stir frequently to prevent sticking).
  3. Add tomatoes and remaining spices, saute for about 2 more minutes.
  4. Add lentils and stir together.
  5. Pressure cook on high for 5 minutes, then let rest for another 5 minutes before releasing pressure.
  6. If not using a pressure cooker, cook lentils on stove top until tender (~15-20 minutes).
  7. Stir in lime juice and cliantro.
  8. Serve with rice or naan.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Piping Pot Curry

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lb salmon fillet
  • 10 prunes, pitted
  • 10 green olives, sliced
  • 2 tbsp capers with brine
  • 4 garlic cloves, chopped
  • 1 tbsp dried oregano
  • 1 bay leaf
  • 0.25 cup red wine vinegar
  • 0.25 cup olive oil
  • black pepper

docs.title: Optional
docs.text:
• 0.25 cup brown sugar
  • 0.25 cup white wine

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 350 deg F.
  2. Marinate salmon with prunes, olives, capers, garlic, oregano, bay leaf, red wine vinegar, olive oil, and black pepper.
  3. Coat baking pan with oil.
  4. Place salmon in baking pan, then cover with marinade.
  5. If using brown sugar and white wine, sprinkle over the top.
  6. Bake until salmon is cooked (about 30 minutes).

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • Can substitute salmon for chicken (and perhaps other meats as well).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Lemony Thyme

docs.title: Stir-Fried Brussels Sprouts with Fish Sauce and Lime
Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pound brussels sprouts
  • 2 tbsp lime juice
  • 1 tbsp fish sauce
  • 1 tbsp dark brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp oil
  • 2 shallots, thinly sliced
  • 4 green onions, thinly sliced
  • 1 inch ginger, match-sticked
  • 1 Thai chile
  • 1 tsp kosher salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cut brussels sprouts in half, then slice length-wise as thinly as possible.
  2. In a bowl, mix lime juice, fish sauce; dissolve sugar in the mixture.
  3. In a wok, fry the shallots, green onions, ginger, chili, and salt.
  4. Add brussels sprouts and stir-fry until sprouts are just cooked (still a little crunch).
  5. Add sauce and combine.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Vegetable Revelations (Steven Satterfield)

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• This needs a wok with very high heat to work right, otherwise it just gets a little soggy.
  • When done right, the okra has none of the gooeyness that frequently turns people off.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 lbs okra
  • 1 tbsp oil
  • fish sauce

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Clean and cut okra to 3/4 in long peices.
  2. Heat oil in wok over low heat.
  3. Once the oil it hot, turn heat to very high and add okra.
  4. Stir fry okra until the peices start to char a bit on the outside.
  5. Remove from heat and add fish sauce to taste.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: self

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 500 g ground pork
  • 1 tbsp cooking oil
  • 100 g thai basil (whole leaves)
  • 2 ea thai chilis
  • 8 ea garlic cloves (chopped)
  • fish sauce

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Heat wok on low and add oil, then add pork and cook until just done.
  2. Move pork to the side of the wok, as high as you can (to keep away from the heat), some liquid (fat and water) should pool in the center of the wok.
  3. Add garlic and chilis to the fluid in the center and let cook on low for a while, let it get a little soft and develop a good fragrance. During this time, the pork should get a little crispy with a few brown crunchy bits on it.
  4. Turn the heat up very high and quickly mix the pork and garlic.
  5. Once mixed, add the thai basil and contingue to stirfry until the leaves are just wilted.
  6. Remove from heat and place in bowl, add fish sauce to taste.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• This is better with hot / holy basil, but it's harder to find. We can reliably source thai basil.
  • Best done in a wok.
  • Where we buy thai basil, it comes in 100 gram portions of stalks and leaves. It's about 1/2 leaves by weight. The 100 grams above is for just the leaves.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: self

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 3 tbsp white wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp honey
  • 1 tbsp lim juice
  • 1/2 teaspoon lime zest
  • 1 clove garlic, grated
  • 1 teaspoon coriander, ground
  • 1 teaspoon sumac, ground
  • 1 teaspoon kosher salt
  • 1/2 cup olive oil

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Whisk all but the olive oil together in a bowl.
  2. Once combined, slowly whisk in the olive oil (to emulsify the mixture).
  3. Taste and adjust seasonings as desired.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Vegetable Revelations (Steven Satterfield)

docs.title: Sweet Sticky Rice
docs.text: For desserts like grilled bananas with coconut cream and turmeric or mango sticky rice.

docs.title: Rice
docs.text: • 2 cups dry sticky rice (sometimes called sweet of glutinous rice)

docs.title: Sauce
docs.text:
• 2 cups coconut milk
  • 0.25 cups sugar
  • 2 tbsp palm sugar
  • 1 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Soak sticky rice overnight (can do quicker, but at least 2 hours).
  2. Steam in a cheesecloth (can be with a traditional sticky rice steamer, but I've had plenty of success with the stainless-steel western steamers).
  3. While rice is cooking, mix the sauce ingredients and simmer until sugar is dissolved.
  4. When rice is complete, put in a dish just big enough to hold it and pour warm sauce over it. Allow to soak for a bit before serving.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: 1. This is a much less sweet version of the one from the source below. It uses 1/6th the sugar of the original, but I think it is still sufficiently sweet.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Simple Thai Food

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.75 pound plum tomatoes (finely diced)
  • 0.25 cup quinoa
  • 2 tsp salt (divided)
  • 2 cup flat-leafed parsely (finely chopped)
  • 1 cup mint (finely chopped)
  • 2 ea scallions (finely chopped)
  • 5 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.25 tsp coriander (ground)
  • 1 pinch cinnamon (ground)
  • 1 taste black pepper (freshly ground)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Season tomatoes with 1 tsp salt and toss to combine. Transfer to fine mesh strainer and allow to drain for 20 minutes (reserve liquid)
  2. Season parsley with remaining 1 teaspoon salt and toss to combine. Transfer to cheese cloth or strainer over bowl to let stand for 20 minutes to remove moisture.
  3. Cook quinoa using liquid from tomatoes (add water if required)
  4. Combine all ingredients in large bowl

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Serious Eats

docs.title: Tamil Black Pepper Chicken
docs.text: Chicken Kozhumbu

docs.title: Marinade
docs.text:
• 800 gram chicken
  • 0.5 tsp black peppercorns, crushed
  • 2 tbsp lemon juice
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 2 tsp ginger, grated
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced

docs.title: Spice Mix
docs.text:
• 2 tsp black peppercorns
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp fennel seeds
  • 3 cloves
  • 1 tbsp coriander seeds
  • 1 dried chili

docs.title: Masala
docs.text:
• 1 tbsp coconut oil
  • 15 curry leaves
  • 2 onion, sliced
  • 7 cm cinnamon
  • 2 black cardamom (optional)
  • 3 fresh chilies, split
  • 2 tomatoes, chopped
  • 1 tsp turmeric powder
  • Salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Cut chicken into bit sized pieces.
  2. Mix marinade ingredients in bowl, then mix the chicken into that. Let marinade for 30 minutes.
  3. Toast spice mix ingredients in a skillet on the stove (if any of the spiced are not whole, put them in at the end so they do not burn).
  4. Let the toasted spices cool, then grind in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle.
  5. Heat oil in pan, add curry leaves, cinnamon, onions, and some salt. Saute until the unions start to brown.
  6. Add tomatoes and cook until tomatoes become mushy.
  7. Add the spice mix and turmeric and saute for a minute.
  8. Increase to high heat, add chicken and mix well, add water if needed (to prevent burning), then turn the heat down to simmer and cover. Cook for 30 minutes, check / stir periodically to prevent sticking. You may need to add some water.
  9. Once the chicken is soft, remove the top and turn heat up to cook off liquid (to your liking, usually the curry is eaten dry).
  10. Let rest for a few minutes before serving.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • We found this while looking for a replication of Zyka's chicken kalimirch. It's not a perfect substitute, but still very good.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Hari Ghotra

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 can salmon
  • 3 scallions
  • 2 ea thai chilis
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 inch ginger root, grated
  • 2 ea eggs
  • 1 tbsp coconut flour
  • 1 tsp cumin
  • 1 tsp coriander
  • 1 tsp fish sauce
  • 0.25 tsp salt
  • 1 tbsp coconut oil

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Preheat oven to 375 deg F.
  2. Beat eggs and mix in all ingredients.
  3. Make cakes (approximately 2.5 inches in diamter, 0.25 to 0.5 inches thick).
  4. Bake on greased cookie sheet for 12 to 20 minutes, until done.

docs.text: Unknown

docs.title: Tomato Basil Soup
docs.text: with carrots, makes 48 oz, requires a pressure cooker

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 2 pounds roma tomatoes
  • 1 ea onion, quartered
  • 1 cup carrots, diced
  • 2 cup zucchini, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 tbsp fish sauce
  • 1 tsp dried oregano
  • 400 ml coconut milk
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 0.5 tsp black pepper
  • 10 leaves fresh basil

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Put everything in the pressure cooker and mix (mostly so the liquid is well distributed and things don't burn).
  2. Cook on high pressure for 5 miuntes.
  3. Let depressurize for at least 10 minutes, then release pressure.
  4. Add basil.
  5. Blend to desired consistency (with immersion blender, or transfer to jug blender).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Meal Plan Addict

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1.75 cup coconut milk
  • 1.75 cup coconut cream
  • 0.25 cup liquid sweetner
  • 0.75 cup sugar
  • 2 tsp vanilla extract
  • 0.5 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Combine everything except vanilla in a sauce pan on medium heat and bring to a simmer (be sure to stir so nothing burns).
  2. Blend the mixture (wither traditional or immersion blender is fine).
  3. Mix in vanilla extract and pour into an airtight container, put in refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
  4. Once chilled, churn in ice cream maker.
  5. Once the ice cream is done, you can eat immediately (for a much softer ice cream) or put in an air tight container in the freezer for at least 5 hours to stiffen.

docs.title: Notes
docs.text: • For the liquid sweetner, the original recipe calls for light corn syrup, we usually use either honey or maple syrup.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Serious Eats

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• oil
  • 1 ea medium onion (diced)
  • 1 lb mushroom (sliced)
  • 0.75 tsp thyme (dry)
  • 0.75 tsp rosemary (dry)
  • 4 cloves garlic
  • 2 tbsp cornstarch
  • 2 tsp soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp dijon mustard
  • 3 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 lb butternut squash (cubed)
  • 3 cups white beans (cooked)
  • 2 cups coconut milk
  • 0.75 tsp salt
  • 0.75 tsp pepper

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Roast the butternut with oil in the oven (425 deg F for ~30 minutes).
  2. Saute onion in oil.
  3. Add mushrooms, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper; cook until mushrooms are mostly done.
  4. Add garlic and cook for ~1 minute.
  5. Add cornstarch until incorporated.
  6. Add mustard, soy sauce, cooked butternut squash, beans, and coconut milk.
  7. Cook for another 10 minutes, adjust taste as needed.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Minimalist Baker

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 150 g mushrooms (cut)
  • 1 tbsp stock
  • 1 pinch salt
  • 1 pinch sugar
  • 3 tbsp lime juice
  • 2 tbsp fish sauce
  • 1 pinch chili powder
  • 2 ea shallots
  • 1 handful mint (chopped)
  • 1 handful cilantro (chopped)
  • 2 tbsp long-lead coriander (chopped)
  • 1 tbsp scallions (chopped)
  • 1 tbsp roasted rice (ground)

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Boil mushrooms with salt and sugar (if using)
  2. While cooking, mix all other ingredients in bowl
  3. Mix mushrooms with the other ingredients (except for rice)
  4. Sprinkle with rice just before serving

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Thai Food

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 1 pound wild mushrooms
  • 2 tbsp oil
  • 1-1/2 tsp kosher salt
  • 1 pound asparagus, 2-inch pieces
  • 2 shallots, sliced in rings
  • 1 cup marsala wine
  • 2 tbsp unsalted butter

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. If mushrooms are large, cut into bite-sized chunks.
  2. In an oiled pan, cook mushrooms until they release moisture and turn brown (3-6 minutes).
  3. Add asparagus and shallots, cook until asparagus is tender.
  4. Set aside pan contents in another dish.
  5. Add marsala wine and butter to pan, cook and whisk until sauce is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.
  6. Drizzle sauce over mushrooms and asparagus, then serve.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Vegetable Revelations (Steven Satterfield)

docs.title: Yogurt Biscuits
docs.text: makes 4 big biscuits

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup yogurt
  • 1 cup flour
  • 0.5 tbsp baking powder
  • 0.125 tsp baking soda
  • 0.5 tsp salt
  • 4 tbsp unsalted butter

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Combine dry ingredients.
  2. Pre-heat oven to 425 deg F.
  3. Cut butter into roughly 0.25-in x 0.25-in cubes and cut into dry ingredients.
  4. Add yogurt, fold into mixture with spatula.
  5. Flatten and fold onto itself several times (to make the flakes).
  6. Flatten one last time to roughly 0.5 - 0.75 inches thick, cut biscuits to desired size.
  7. Place biscuits on greased cooking pan and cook for 15 minutes (until golden brown on top).

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Serious Eats

docs.title: Zucchini Carrot Muffins
docs.text: Mostly for kids.

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text:
• 0.5 cup carrot (grated, squeezed dry)
  • 0.5 cup zucchini (grated, squeezed dry)
  • 2 eggs (beaten)
  • 1 banana (mashed)
  • 0.25 cup oil (or melted butter)
  • 1.25 cup oatmeal flour
  • 1 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 0.5 tsp baking soda
  • 0.25 tsp salt

docs.title: Preparation
docs.text:
1. Pre-heat oven to 375 deg F.
  2. Mash banana and mix all ingredients together (use a blender for all but the oat flour, then mix in the oat flour).
  3. Separate into mini-muffin tin.
  4. Bake for 15 minutes, remove and let cool.

docs.title: Source
docs.text: Yummy Toddler Food
